results.title: Ivabradine and atenolol overdose managed with renal replacement therapy: A case report.
results.text_hl: This case report discusses the clinical course of a @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ who presented with profound @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ after ingesting large doses of @CHEMICAL_Ivabradine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077550 @@@ivabradine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Weigel B, Stott M, Tyler D, Ball M, Crutchfield C. Ivabradine and atenolol overdose managed with renal replacement therapy: A case report. Am J Emerg Med. 2025 May 29;():. PMID: 40461358
citations.BibTeX: @article{40461358, title={Ivabradine and atenolol overdose managed with renal replacement therapy: A case report.}, author={Weigel B and Stott M and Tyler D and Ball M and Crutchfield C}, journal={Am J Emerg Med}}

results.title: Extracorporeal treatment for poisoning to beta-adrenergic antagonists: systematic review and recommendations from the EXTRIP workgroup
results.text_hl: Indications for ECTR in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@impaired kidney function@@@ include refractory @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ for @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Sotalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013015 @@@sotalol@@@ @DISEASE_Poisoning @DISEASE_MESH:D011041 @@@poisoning@@@, and recurrent @DISEASE_Torsades_de_Pointes @DISEASE_MESH:D016171 @@@torsade de pointes@@@ for @CHEMICAL_Sotalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013015 @@@sotalol@@@.

citations.NLM: Bouchard J, Shepherd G, Hoffman RS, Gosselin S, Roberts DM, Li Y, Nolin TD, Lavergne V, Ghannoum M, EXTRIP workgroup. Extracorporeal treatment for poisoning to beta-adrenergic antagonists: systematic review and recommendations from the EXTRIP workgroup Crit Care. 2021 Jun 10;25(1):201. PMID: 34112223
citations.BibTeX: @article{34112223, title={Extracorporeal treatment for poisoning to beta-adrenergic antagonists: systematic review and recommendations from the EXTRIP workgroup}, author={Bouchard J and Shepherd G and Hoffman RS and Gosselin S and Roberts DM and Li Y and Nolin TD and Lavergne V and Ghannoum M and EXTRIP workgroup}, journal={Crit Care}, volume={25}, number={1}, pages={201}}

results.title: Successful Therapeutic Hypothermia in a Patient with Drug-Induced J Waves and Cardiac Arrest: A Case Report
results.text_hl: A 50-year-old man was admitted to our hospital with @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ after receiving high doses of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, and @CHEMICAL_etizolam @CHEMICAL_MESH:C044610 @@@etizolam@@@.

citations.NLM: Sato J, Yagi T, Shimada E, Kobori M, Watanabe K, Kuwana T, Chiba N, Saito T, Kinoshita K. Successful Therapeutic Hypothermia in a Patient with Drug-Induced J Waves and Cardiac Arrest: A Case Report Ther Hypothermia Temp Manag. 2023 Sep 19;():. PMID: 37722017
citations.BibTeX: @article{37722017, title={Successful Therapeutic Hypothermia in a Patient with Drug-Induced J Waves and Cardiac Arrest: A Case Report}, author={Sato J and Yagi T and Shimada E and Kobori M and Watanabe K and Kuwana T and Chiba N and Saito T and Kinoshita K}, journal={Ther Hypothermia Temp Manag}}

results.title: Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review.
results.text_hl: However, it is reasonable to have a graduated response to @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@cardiovascular instability@@@ beginning with intravenous fluids, commencement of a single or a combination of @CHEMICAL_Catecholamines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002395 @@@catecholamine@@@ inotropes and vasopressors depending upon the type of haemodynamic compromise (@<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@, @DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular dysfunction@@@, vasodilation).

citations.NLM: Rotella JA, Greene SL, Koutsogiannis Z, Graudins A, Hung Leang Y, Kuan K, Baxter H, Bourke E, Wong A. Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review. Clin Toxicol (Phila). 2020 Oct;58(10):943-983. PMID: 32310006
citations.BibTeX: @article{32310006, title={Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review.}, author={Rotella JA and Greene SL and Koutsogiannis Z and Graudins A and Hung Leang Y and Kuan K and Baxter H and Bourke E and Wong A}, journal={Clin Toxicol (Phila)}, volume={58}, number={10}, pages={943-983}}

results.title: A Case of Life-threatening Amlodipine and Atenolol Overdose
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ is a beta blocker (BB) and these drugs competitively antagonize beta-1 adrenoceptors in cardiac muscles and produce direct depressant action on the myocardium, resulting in conduction delays, @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ and reduced contractility with little or no effect on peripheral vasculature.

citations.NLM: Tale S, Kumar M, Ghosh S, Bhalla A. A Case of Life-threatening Amlodipine and Atenolol Overdose Indian J Crit Care Med. 2019 Jun;23(6):281-283. PMID: 31435148
citations.BibTeX: @article{31435148, title={A Case of Life-threatening Amlodipine and Atenolol Overdose}, author={Tale S and Kumar M and Ghosh S and Bhalla A}, journal={Indian J Crit Care Med}, volume={23}, number={6}, pages={281-283}}

results.title: [Effect of atenolol on MAO activities in SHR].
results.text_hl: The MAO activities were determined once every 2 weeks. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ produced a @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotensive@@@ effect and @<m>DISEASE_Bradycardia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ in SHR.

citations.NLM: Tsuji T, Ohba T, Nakayama S, Sakamoto K. [Effect of atenolol on MAO activities in SHR]. Nihon Yakurigaku Zasshi. 1986 Apr;87(4):435-43. PMID: 3721361
